The response provides a comprehensive plan for federated learning in low-resource countries, explicitly pairing identified risks (low bandwidth, intermittent connectivity, heterogeneous/low-end devices, stricter privacy needs) with specific mitigation strategies. For example, communication-efficient FL techniques (quantization, sparsification) are proposed to address low bandwidth, and asynchronous or buffered strategies are suggested for intermittent connectivity. Resource-constrained training methods like layer-wise training and depth dropout are offered for heterogeneous/low-end devices, and DP-FedAvg with secure aggregation is presented for privacy concerns. Each experiment section details hypotheses, methods, ablations, and evaluation metrics, all of which are designed to address these risks.
